comment: Her Human communications class is easy to follow. She says, communication is not common sense, but I personally think it is. At least textbook wise. She grades homework and tests along with attendence to make the overall grade. Attend class and do homework and you'll be guarenteed at least a C. She's funny and caring, but she strays off topic often
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Taking the ORGC capstone class 100% online is very stressful and I recommend taking it hybrid or fully in-person instead. However, Dr. Mathis was there to help us through the uncertainty and was very responsive to email. You can trust that Dr. Mathis will be there to help. Email for clarification constantly since instructions will be unclear.
Great teacher! So forgiving and thoughtful to students who may've fallen behind on their work. The class workload isn't too demanding; remember to keep up with it.

Workload was very easy. Online textbook quizzes every week that you can google and takes about 10 minutes max. She does take attendance but being in class is so pointless it makes it hard to want to show up.
She is super sweet! Exams are easy and so are weekly quizzes. She is very lecture heavy and relys on class participation. Easy A!

If you can take anyone else DO IT! If not be prepared for anxiety for 16 weeks. Class is very unorganized leaving students with a lot of uncertainty regarding assignments, grades, and scheduling. If you are confused, as much of the class was, she offers office hours, but you should not have to do more work just to get clear instruction.

Personally-she's delightful. She wants you to like communication as much as she does. it can feel really confusing & unorganized bc she's that way. Ask clarifying questions. If you think you're lost it's probably because she's jumped topics so you NEED to ask. She wants to provide clarity...it just doesn't come naturally. Be your own advocate.

I took Doctor Mathis for a research class and actually enjoyed the class. I didn't expect to enjoy research but Mathis' knowledge and excitement about the class made me want to go to class. She has a habit of going on slight tangents but the stories are always entertaining. The whole class is basically on big paper so be prepared to write.

Shes very sweet and course load is very easy and absolutely manageable. The only thing I have had a problem with is her grading criteria. She can be confusing, but I think its just the fact that she is online and D2L can be confusing to navigate. If you ask her, however, she will quickly give you helpful clarification. Take her!

Took two courses online with her this semester and was confused all semester long. Everything was suuuuper unorganized and difficult to follow. Rubrics were also super vague. Thankfully, she is very accesible to talk to and answer questions. She's a lenient grader though and super sweet.

Unless you want to be stressed out the entire semester, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. She is a really sweet woman, but she is so unorganized and the way she lays out her class causes everyone a lot of unnecessary anxiety. The work itself isnt that difficult, her instructions are just very confusing and overly complicated.

Professor Mathis is super passionate about how she teaches and you learn a lot in her classes. I was super worried at the beginning of the semester but if you have any questions, just email her. Her tests are super straight forward but make sure to study and pay attention to her lectures. Otherwise, I don't have any complaints about her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Wonderful woman. A bit scatter brained and unorganized causing stress to her students. Everyone complained. If I hadnt taken her in a hybrid course I think I would liked her better. I believe to teach a hybrid course the professor must be hybrid as well as the students for success. She was not.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: She was a very easy going professor but talked a lot off topic. I still haven't learned one thing from this course. Doesn't respond to emails quickly and can sometimes be sarcastic. The work itself was not hard. I would take her again because I know how to teach myself something I don't understand. If you can do this, take her.

I loved this professor. She really cares about her students and is always there to help when you need it. The tests are only hard if you do not study and do not look over the objectives. There were barely any pop quizzes and they did not really count anyways. 3 tests and a paper at the end of the semester. I wish I could take her again!

I don't know why Professor Mathis got some bad reviews on here, she's really nice and funny. Her class isn't hard. With minimal effort and the ability to follow directions, I've managed to get an A. Make sure you're familiar with the bolded terms in the book, and you'll get an A on the exams. I enjoy going to class, it's interesting. Take her!

I took the introduction to public speaking expecting to get a credit and not add to much work load to my schedule as I already had a heavy load. I signed up for Mathis' class and it turned out to be perhaps the most time consuming. Do not take Mathis' class if you are looking for a credit. She will assign a lot of homework and a dress code.
Not the best professor I've had so far. Lectures are so long and she sometimes gets lost into what she's saying. Grades harsh on speeches.
Great class, she loves to ramble on about stuff.

Dr. Mathis was an excellent professor. very easy to get along with and keeps your attention the entire time. As long as you complete your work on time and follow the syllabus there will be no problems.

Dr. Mathis was great. She explained what she expected out of her students and what you should expect from her at the beginning of the semester, read the syllabus! Her lectures were not boring, and as long as you read the material you will pass her test. I would take another course with her in a heartbeat.
